page.title: 02FRUIT GROWING IN THE PAST
page.content: { Fruit growing was{formerly the main {occupation of farmers}immediately to the west of the escarpment in the valley. {Apples, plums and cherries}were grown in abundance and a{Cherry Picking Fair in July or late June brought many visitors to Shurdington and children were{given a holiday from school}to help with the harvest. Most orchards have made way for {housing developments}but there is still evidence of the old apple and plum orchards, now greatly reduced in area, and cherries have disappeared altogether.
